benchmark_details.name: Benchmark for Evaluating the Model
benchmark_details.overview: The proposed benchmark evaluates the performance of models in predicting antibiotic resistance genes by integrating information from nucleotide sequences and biological text literature.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for predicting antibiotic resistance genes using integrated language models.

data.size: 5,194 Reference Sequences from CARD, 9,733 Reference Sequences from MEGARes
data.annotation: Annotated based on existing databases including labeled classes for antibiotic resistance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on performance on testing datasets, comparing predictions against actual labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in accuracy and F1 reflect better performance in classifying antibiotic resistance.
methodology.validation: Validation involves checking the weighted soft voting ensemble model against a dedicated validation dataset.
